articles.headline: Wee Mousie, Fear Not a Touch PC
articles.snippet: Finger gestures used on the iPhone can now be used on laptops and full-size computer screens, but the tactile experience isn’t quite the same.
articles.abstract: Finger gestures used on the iPhone can now be used on laptops and full-size computer screens, but the tactile experience isn’t quite the same.

articles.headline: Leaders in House Block Earmarks to Corporations
articles.snippet: The ban would wipe out one of the most controversial means of awarding no-bid contracts to private firms.
articles.abstract: The ban would wipe out one of the most controversial means of awarding no-bid contracts to private firms.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Democratic leaders on Wednesday banned budget earmarks to private industry, ending a practice that has steered billions of dollars in no-bid contracts to companies and set off corruption scandals.

articles.headline: A Place to Bet Real Money on Movies
articles.snippet: A virtual futures exchange is being assembled to allow people to bet money on a film’s box office success.
articles.abstract: A virtual futures exchange is being assembled to allow people to bet money on a film’s box office success.
articles.lead_paragraph: Think that this spring’s “Robin Hood” movie will be a blockbuster at the box office? Next week you will be able to put your money on it.

articles.headline: Nigerians Recount Night of Their Bloody Revenge
articles.snippet: This week dozens of herdsmen slaughtered hundreds of people in a brutal act of sectarian retribution in Jos.
articles.abstract: This week dozens of herdsmen slaughtered hundreds of people in a brutal act of sectarian retribution in Jos.
articles.lead_paragraph: JOS, Nigeria — Dispassionately, the baby-faced young man recounted his killings: two women and one man, first beaten senseless with a stick, then stabbed to death with a short knife.

articles.headline: Gadgets in Emergency Vehicles Seen as Peril
articles.snippet: Police and paramedics use an array of dashboard devices, a boon for their jobs that also presents a clear risk.
articles.abstract: Police and paramedics use an array of dashboard devices, a boon for their jobs that also presents a clear risk.
articles.lead_paragraph: They are the most wired vehicles on the road, with dashboard computers, sophisticated radios, navigation systems and cellphones.

articles.headline: Senate Bill on Finance to Include Agency That Tracks Financial Risk
articles.snippet: The main purpose of the agency, sometimes referred to as the National Institute of Finance, would be to flag problems in the industry before they spread and threaten the wider economy.
articles.abstract: The main purpose of the agency, sometimes referred to as the National Institute of Finance, would be to flag problems in the industry before they spread and threaten the wider economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Banking Committee members from both parties said on Wednesday that they had agreed to include in their regulatory overhaul bill a new Office of Research and Analysis that would provide early warnings of possible systemic collapses.
articles.byline: By Edward Wyatt and Sewell Chan

articles.headline: Goldman Deal-Maker Now Advocates Regulation
articles.snippet: Gary Gensler, head of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, is the leading contender to oversee the instruments that played a key role in the financial crisis.
articles.abstract: Gary Gensler, head of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, is the leading contender to oversee the instruments that played a key role in the financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: For 18 years, Gary G. Gensler worked on Wall Street, striking merger deals at the venerable Goldman Sachs. Then in the late 1990s, he moved to the Treasury Department, joining a Washington establishment that celebrated the power of markets and fought off regulation at almost every turn.

articles.headline: Tanker Deal Gives a Lift to Boeing
articles.snippet: Boeing will now have some welcome certainty about its future as a major builder of military aircraft.
articles.abstract: Boeing will now have some welcome certainty about its future as a major builder of military aircraft.
articles.lead_paragraph: Northrop Grumman’s withdrawal this week from a $40 billion contest to build aerial refueling tankers provides Boeing with some welcome certainty about its future as a major builder of military aircraft.

articles.headline: In Early Tally, Tight Iraq Race Deepens Splits
articles.snippet: Fraud charges heightened concerns over whether Iraq’s fledgling institutions were strong enough to support a peaceful transfer of power.
articles.abstract: Fraud charges heightened concerns over whether Iraq’s fledgling institutions were strong enough to support a peaceful transfer of power.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — Iraq’s major coalitions were locked in a surprisingly close race on Thursday, in initial results from elections that deepened divisions across a fractured landscape. Candidates were quick to charge fraud, heightening concerns whether Iraq’s fledgling institutions were strong enough to support a peaceful transfer of power.
articles.byline: By Anthony Shadid and Tim Arango

articles.headline: Democrats Push Ahead on Finance Bill
articles.snippet: Senator Bob Corker, a Republican on the Senate Banking Committee, called Senator Christopher J. Dodd’s announcement on Thursday “very disappointing.”
articles.abstract: Senator Bob Corker, a Republican on the Senate Banking Committee, called Senator Christopher J. Dodd’s announcement on Thursday “very disappointing.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Democrats said on Thursday that they would go it alone in an effort to pass an overhaul of financial regulation, increasing the likelihood of a bitter partisan showdown.
